steps.text: Clean new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Sand old or new gelcoat to remove imperfections using a DA sander and grade 80+ abrasive discs.
Apply approved cleaner with High Performance Cloth.
Guide coat to surface and re-sand for even texture.
Clean repair area with approved cleaner or pressured air.
Apply 3M™ Marine Blister Repair Filler and feather after 30 minutes.
Apply dry guide coat and re-sand.
Apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler and sand after curing.
Finish by sanding with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II grade 220+.
Ensure surface is dry.
Mask areas with 3M™ Precision Masking Tape and back it up.
Apply 3M™ Purple Premium Plus Masking Film.
Mix gelcoat in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 disposable spray cup.
Adjust 3M™ Performance Spray Gun settings.
Apply gelcoat from 15cm-20cm away.
Refer to the following page for gelcoat finishing process.
Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
If needed, sand with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 320+ and then 400+ grade abrasives.
If the surface is in good condition, start with P800 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Refine the P800 grade sand scratch using P1200 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound and a 3M™ Perfect-It™ Low Linting Wool Compounding Pad using a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm.
Polish with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish and a wool compounding pad at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area and wipe clean before it dries.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Sand the surface using a DA sander and 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 80+ grade abrasive discs.
Apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Sand the filler after it sets with dry guide coat and 120+ grade, then finish sanding with 220+ grade.
Ensure the surface is dry and apply masking tapes and film as described in the gelcoat process.
Mix primer in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup and apply with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun held 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Apply dry guide coat and sand primer with 320+ grade abrasive discs.
Sand primer again with 400+ grade abrasive discs.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Apply marine paint using a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Sand marine paint with 3M™ Hookit™ Purple Finishing Film Disc 260L+ P1200/1500 grade.
Optionally, sand marine paint with water using a 3M™ Trizact™ Hookit™ Clear Coat Sanding Disc grade 1500.
Refine scratches from sanding with 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Disc P2000 grade.
Optionally, refine scratches from sanding with water using 3M™ Trizact™ Hookit™ Foam.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Sand the bottom surface using a dual-action sander and 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron² II 220+ grade abrasive.
Mix and apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
After it cures, sand with 120+ grade abrasive and finish with 220+ grade.
Apply masking.
Ensure the surface is dry before applying masking.
Evaluate product suitability and conduct workplace hazard assessment.
Follow all applicable regulations (e.g., OSHA, ANSI).
Use products with appropriate safety equipment.
Apply bottom paint using a 3M Performance Spray Gun, holding it 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Consult a safety professional or visit www.3M.com.
Contact 3M UK plc for automotive aftermarket inquiries.
Contact 3M Ireland Limited for automotive aftermarket inquiries.
